get.description: Read a single object.

post.description:
Return object ids for the given project with the filters.

Optionally:

    - fields will specify the needed object (and ancilliary entities) fields
    - order_field will order the result using given field, If prefixed with "-" then it will be reversed.
    - window_start & window_size allows to return only a slice of the result.

Fields follow the naming convention: `prefix.field`.
    Prefix is either 'obj' for main object, 'fre' for free fields, 'img' for the visible image.
    Use a comma to separate fields.
    - Column obj.imgcount contains the total count of images for the object.

For the given project, with given filters, return the classification summary, i.e.:
    - Total number of objects
Also if 'only_total' is not set:
    - Number of Validated ones
    - Number of Dubious ones
    - Number of Predicted ones
Reset to Predicted all objects for the given project with the filters.

Revert all objects for the given project, with the filters, to the target.
- param `filters`: The set of filters to apply to get the target objects.
- param `dry_run`: If set, then no real write but consequences of the revert will be replied.
- param `target`: Use null/None for reverting using the last annotation from anyone, or a user id
    for the last annotation from this user.

Regardless of present classification or state, set the new classification for this object set.
If the filter designates "all with given classification", add a TaxonomyChangeLog entry.
:returns the number of affected objects.

Update all the objects with given IDs and values
Current user needs Manage right on all projects of specified objects.

Change classification and/or qualification for a set of objects.
Current user needs at least Annotate right on all projects of specified objects.

Set automatic classification of a set of objects.
 - `params`: None, all is in the Request body.
Return object ids, with parent ones and projects for the objects in given list.
Start an export job for the given object set and options.

delete.description:
Delete the objects with given object ids.
Current user needs Manage right on all projects of specified objects.

get.description: Return the status of taxonomy tree w/r to freshness.

Dig into reclassification logs and, for each input category id, determine the most chosen target category,
excluding the advised one.
By convention, if nothing relevant is found, the input category itself is returned. So one can expect
that the returned list has the same size as the required one.

schema.title: Response Reclassif Stats Taxa Reclassification Stats Get

get.description: Dig into reclassification logs and return the associations source->target for previous reclassifications.
Information about a single taxon, including its lineage.
Where a given taxon is used. Only validated uses are returned.

schema.title: Response Query Taxa Usage Taxon  Taxon Id  Usage Get

get.description:
Search for taxa by name.

Queries can be 'small', i.e. of length < 3 and even zero-length.
For a public, unauthenticated call:
- zero-length and small queries always return nothing.
- otherwise, a full search is done and results are returned in alphabetical order.

Behavior for an authenticated call:
- zero-length queries: return the MRU list in full.
- small queries: the MRU list is searched, so that taxa in the recent list are returned, if matching.
- otherwise, a full search is done. Results are ordered so that taxa in the project list are in first,
    and are signalled as such in the response.

schema.title: Response Search Taxa Taxon Set Search Get

get.description:
Information about several taxa, including their lineage.
The separator between numbers is arbitrary non-digit, e.g. ":", "|" or ","

schema.title: Response Query Taxa Set Taxon Set Query Get

get.description: Get EcoTaxoServer full record for this taxon.

put.description:
Create a taxon on EcoTaxoServer.
Logged user must be manager (on any project) or application admin.

get.description: Push present instance stats into EcoTaxoServer.
Get what changed in EcoTaxoServer managed tree and update local tree accordingly.
Return the jobs for current user, or all of them if admin and asked for.
Return the job by its id.

post.description:
Send answers to last question. The job resumes after it receives the reply.
Note: It's only about data storage here.
If the data is technically NOK e.g. not a JS object, standard 422 error should be thrown.
If the data is incorrect from consistency point of view, the job will return in Asking state.

get.description:
Restart the job by its id.
The job must be in a restartable state, and be accessible to current user.

Return the log file produced by given task.
The task must belong to requester.

Return the file produced by given task.
The task must belong to requester.

delete.description:
Delete the job, from DB and with associated storage.
If the job is running then kill it.

Is the person who 
        is responsible for the content of this metadata record. Writer of the title and abstract.

contact_user.title: Contact user
contact_user.description:
Is the person who 
        should be contacted in cases of questions regarding the content of the dataset or any data restrictions. 
        This is also the person who is most likely to stay involved in the dataset the longest.

creator_users.title: Creator users
creator_users.description:
All people who 
        are responsible for the creation of the collection. Data creators should receive credit 
        for their work and should therefore be included in the citation.

Constants.title: Constants

license_texts.title: The supported licenses and help text/links

default.CC0 1.0: CC-0: all registered EcoTaxa users are free to download, redistribute, modify, and build upon the data, with no conditions. Other databases can index the data. The data falls into the worldwide public domain. This is the license preferred by OBIS and GBIF.
default.CC BY 4.0: CC-BY: all registered EcoTaxa users are free to download, redistribute, modify, and build upon the data, as long as they cite the dataset and its authors. Other databases can index the data.
default.CC BY-NC 4.0: CC-BY-NC: all registered EcoTaxa users are free to download, redistribute, modify, and build upon the data, as long as they cite the dataset and its authors, and do not use it for commercial purpose ("primarily intended for or directed toward commercial advantage or monetary compensation"). Other databases can index the data.
default.Copyright: Copyright: only contributors to this project have rights on this data. This prevents its distribution in any kind of database.

app_manager.title: The application manager identity (name, mail), from config file

split_by.title: For 'TSV' type, inside archives, split in one directory per... 'sample', 'taxo' or '' (no split)

coma_as_separator.title: For 'TSV' type, use a , instead of . for decimal separator.

format_dates_times.title: For 'TSV' type, format dates and times using - and : respectively.

with_images.title: For 'BAK' and 'DOI' types, export images as well.

with_internal_ids.title: For 'BAK' and 'DOI' types, export internal DB IDs.

only_first_image.title: For 'DOI' type, export only first (displayed) image.

sum_subtotal.title: For 'SUM' type, how subtotals should be calculated. Per A(cquisition) or S(ample) or ''

out_to_ftp.title: Copy result file to FTP area. Original file is still available.

group_type.description: Define the groups in which to apply limits. C for categories, S for samples, A for acquisitions.

limit_type.title: Limit type
limit_type.description: The type of limit_value: P for %, V for constant, both per group.

limit_value.title: Limit value
limit_value.description: Limit value, e.g. 20% or 5 per copepoda or 5% per sample.

job_id.title: Job Id
job_id.description: The job created for this operation.

renm_id.title: The advised replacement ID iif the taxon/category is deprecated.

pr.title: 1 if the taxon is in project list, 0 otherwise.

renm_id.title: The advised replacement ID iif the taxon/category is deprecated.

nb_objects.title: How many objects are classified in this category.

nb_children_objects.title: How many objects are classified in this category children (not itself).

lineage.title: The taxon/category name of ancestors, including self, in first.

id_lineage.title: The taxon/category IDs of ancestors, including self, in first.

nb_validated.title: How many validated objects in this category in this project

last_refresh.title: Taxonomy tree last refresh/sync from taxonomy server. Date, with format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.
